meanings.sent1: Her ingrained love for animals made her volunteer at the shelter every weekend.
meanings.sent2: The tradition of family game night was ingrained in their weekly routine.
meanings.sent3: His ingrained habit of checking his phone every five minutes became a running joke among his friends.
meanings.sent4: The importance of honesty was ingrained in her like a tattoo on her soul.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh bread baking was ingrained in her memory from childhood.

meanings.definition: Deeply rooted or ingrained in a person's nature or behavior
meanings.sent1: His ingrained fear of spiders made him scream at the sight of a tiny one.
meanings.sent2: The ingrained kindness of the old lady touched everyone she met.
meanings.sent3: The ingrained clumsiness of the puppy made everyone laugh as it tripped over its own paws.
meanings.sent4: The ingrained wisdom of the elder was like a beacon of light in the community.
meanings.sent5: The sound of waves crashing on the shore was ingrained in his soul, calming him instantly.
